JUDGES: Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in ORG . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON . PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant is a businessman and a political opposition supporter in GPE , who participated in protest rallies following the constitutional referendum in DATE and the presidential elections in DATE ( and was briefly arrested and allegedly beaten up by the police after the last - mentioned event ) , provided financial support to QUANTITY of the opposition parties , and initiated some ORG protest actions at a local level . From DATE he and his wife allegedly received anonymous threats . In DATE the financial police allegedly demanded from the applicant a bribe of MONEY ( ORG ) not to institute criminal proceedings against him , about which he complained to ORG . The threats against him allegedly became more serious thereafter .
In DATE the applicant left GPE for an unspecified country .
Since DATE he has been living in GPE .
In DATE the applicant was charged in absentia in GPE with illegal entrepreneurial activities ( a criminal offence ) .
On DATE ORG decided to remand him in custody and on DATE the applicant was declared wanted by the police .
On DATE he applied to ORG for refugee status .
On DATE he was notified that his application had been rejected and appealed .

On DATE ORG sent a letter to ORG and ORG in the GPE region instructing it to register the applicant at the address indicated in GPE pending the examination of his appeal till DATE . The outcome of the appeal proceedings is unknown .

On DATE the applicant was additionally charged in GPE with the creation and management of a criminal organisation and tax evasion in respect of particularly large sums . On DATE ORG again decided to remand him in custody and on DATE he was again declared wanted by the police .
During DATE the applicant was arrested CARDINAL times by the NORP police at the request of the GPE authorities and subsequently released , with his last release dated DATE .
On DATE the ORG lodged an official request for the applicant ’s extradition , which remains pending before the NORP authorities . The request contained the following assurances :
- the applicant would not be prosecuted for any other crime committed before the extradition without the consent of ORG of GPE ;
- he would not be removed to a third country without the consent of ORG of GPE ;
- he would not be subjected to torture , inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment ;
- after the termination of the criminal proceedings or after serving his sentence , if one was imposed , the applicant would be free to leave GPE ;
- the request for extradition was not made in order to prosecute the applicant for political , racial , religious or ethnic reasons .

On DATE the applicant requested ORG to prohibit ORG from extraditing him to GPE , alleging that there was a risk that he would be subjected to ill - treatment by GPE law - enforcement officials and would not enjoy the benefit of a fair trial .

On DATE the President of the ORG indicated to ORG , under LAW , that the applicant should not be removed to GPE unless and until ORG had had the opportunity to consider the case further . At the same time , a factual request was sent to the Government with questions , in particular whether the NORP authorities had received any assurances in respect of the applicant and whether they had had or would have regard to the risk of the applicant ’s ill - treatment in GPE .
On DATE the Prosecutor General of Belarus supplemented the assurances that the applicant would be ensured a fair trial and that he would be provided with adequate medical treatment if needed .

By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the Prosecutor General of GPE informed ORG that relations between GPE and GPE in the extradition domain were quite positive . In particular , DATE and DATE GPE extradited to GPE CARDINAL people charged with criminal offences or for execution of sentences . None of those extraditions was followed by any complaints from the extradited individuals , their representatives or non - governmental organisations concerning any violations of their rights . Therefore , ORG considered that there were no reasons not to trust the assurances from his GPE counterpart . The above - mentioned letter also contained the following statement :

“ In connection with Mr PERSON ’s application to ORG and having regard to the ORG ’s requirement under LAW to suspend his extradition , ORG Office of GPE guarantees that this person will not be extradited to law - enforcement authorities of GPE until the ORG has considered the case . ”

In their reply of CARDINAL DATE to the ORG ’s factual request the ORG noted that ORG had not yet decided on the applicant ’s extradition to GPE and that the NORP authorities would take into account any risks of violation of the applicant ’s rights under the ORG in case of his extradition . The applicant commented that those assurances were insufficient .

On DATE the President of the ORG decided to maintain until further notice the interim measure indicated under LAW and to give priority treatment to the above application in accordance with Rule CARDINAL of ORG .

On DATE the Government informed the ORG about new legislation enacted in DATE ( see PERSON part below ) and requested the ORG to lift the interim measure indicated in the case . They maintained that the new procedure was directly available to the applicant , the courts were authorised to refuse his extradition if they considered that it would violate his Convention rights , and that ORG decisions on extradition could no longer be enforced immediately .
The applicant disagreed , claiming that under the newly introduced extradition procedure it was impossible to suspend decisions to extradite .
In the light of the parties’ submissions , on DATE the President of the ORG decided to discontinue application of the interim measure indicated under LAW .
On DATE the applicant presented a letter from CARDINAL of the opposition leaders , PERSON , confirming the applicant ’s involvement in opposition activities .
The parties have not informed the ORG about any decision on extradition taken by the ORG in the applicant ’s case to date .
On DATE LAW introduced a new chapter to LAW regulating proceedings for extradition to and from GPE . Relevant articles of this new chapter provide , among other things , as follows :
Article CARDINAL . Refusal to extradite a person
“ A decision not to extradite a person to a foreign state may be taken if :
CARDINAL NORP the person ’s extradition is incompatible with the obligations of GPE under international treaties to which GPE is a party ... ”
Article CARDINAL . Decision on a request for extradition

“ ... If a decision to extradite a person is taken ... , the person shall be issued with a copy of the decision . If such a decision has not been challenged before a court within DATE , the authorities shall organise the actual extradition of the person to the relevant authorities of the foreign state . ”
Article CARDINAL . Procedure for appeal against a decision to extradite a person
“ A decision to extradite a person may be appealed against by the person concerned , his or her defence counsel or legal representative before a local court ...

An appeal shall be examined in a single - judge formation within DATE of the date of its receipt by the court . The hearing shall be held in the presence of the prosecutor , the person concerned , and his or her defence counsel or legal representative if the latter participates in the proceedings .
Following the examination , the judge shall take a reasoned decision to :
CARDINAL reject the appeal ;
CARDINAL allow the appeal and quash the decision to extradite .

An appeal against the judge ’s decision may be lodged with a court of appeal by the prosecutor who participated in the hearing before the court of first instance or by the person concerned , his or her defence counsel or legal representative , within DATE of the date of delivery of the impugned decision . The lodging of an appeal against the judge ’s decision with the court shall suspend its entry into force and its execution . ”
